Fields.DialogueText: Buon giorno, Capitano!
Buon giorno, Vespucci. It’s good to see you up and about.
I wouldn't miss this day for the world! Are you ready for some sparring? There are a few new techniques I wish to try.

Fields.MenuText: Do these involve acrobatics? I’ve been working on my calisthenics.
As long as you don’t poke me in my ribs again.
Shooting star? Meet the cosmos.

Fields.DialogueText: Acrobatics!? Capitano, I may be a Belle, but there’s only so much I’m capable of.
You need to work on your core, Capitano!
The cosmos is vast, much like my repertoire of techniques...
I’m excited to see what you’ve got for me today, Vespucci.
Likewise, Capitano. Let’s see how much you’ve improved!
*ALARM*
Wha-- Really!?
Hmph! Duty calls... For some reason, Morgana activity has seen an uptick lately.
Then that means we’ll have to show them how much more we’ve improved, eh, Vespucci?
You took the words right out of my mouth!
@BATTLE
Capitano! My pen pal has written me back!

Fields.MenuText: That’s great! What did they say? Anything about tactics?
Who is your pen pal, Vespucci? I recall them being from out east.
You Belles like it old-fashioned, don't you?

Fields.DialogueText: They wrote at length about the principles of "bushido."
Ashigara! She's another Belle from the Empire of Japan.
Say this for us, Capitano - we respect our roots!
Is that a letter from her? My, her calligraphy's incredible.
Her words lack the delicacy of the strokes that make them, but their clarity is unparalleled. ... She’s also quite coarse with her language.
Huh. The more you know. Such different backgrounds... What do you write each other about?
Ashigara seems to believe in embracing one’s soul. Your will is your own, and in battle you impart your soul’s will onto another.
It seems similar to how Epictetus described one’s duties.
"Individuals, however, are responsible for their own actions which they can examine and control through rigorous self-discipline."
"Suffering arises from trying to control what is uncontrollable, or from neglecting what is within our power."
You're taking well to the reading, Capitano!
What can I say? I’m a fast learner... And apparently, so are these Morganas.
Do not be so glib, Capitano! We are the masters of our own destiny!
Our destiny is to get rid of these Morganas. Let’s get started!
@BATTLE
And... stop! Haha, you’re doing wonderfully, Capitano. That’s the third time you’ve stopped my attack!

Fields.MenuText: Forgive me, but I lost count.

Fields.DialogueText: Hmph!
Riposte!

Fields.MenuText: One of these days you’re going to crack my saber in half.
A shooting star indeed.

Fields.DialogueText: What do you mean you’ve lost count!? I said it three times! ... Did I hit you somewhere wrong?
I’ve accidentally cracked one of my parry daggers in the past, so I don’t blame you.
You’re a constellation, Capitano. Your movements are wonderful!
I’ve always wondered... how does Cristoforo Colombo duel? You talk about her a lot.
Cristoforo is... she’s an enigma.
Well, so are the Morganas. I'm sure we could solve this one.
She’s not an enigma in the way the Morganas are, Capitano. The problem is, Cristoforo is like me.
Aha! Then again, you are siblings. If anyone knows you well, it’s her!
That’s true, but it doesn’t make me hate it less. I don’t want her to outsmart me like that!
You shouldn’t be focusing on that, Vespucci. Getting angry at an enigma will not get you any closer to the truth.
Grr... I just want to show her up once! She makes me lose myself...
"Virtue is a habit of the mind, consistent with nature and moderation and reason."
Sì, Capitano. I'm sorry.
It’s all right, Vespucci. I don’t think the problem is with Colombo, but with your tactics. Would you like me to help you refine them?
Sì, I would!
*ALARM*
Ah! An opportunity, Capitano!
Good. Now, the first rule of solving an enigma...
@BATTLE
Sì, Capitano. This time she’s going off about how IJA officers don’t use their swords nearly as often as they should.
Another letter, Vespucci? Is it from Ashigara?

Fields.MenuText: That’s preposterous. Aren’t those swords high quality? Why not use them?
Maybe they rely on pistols more? I know the Germans do.
Sharp blade, sharp mind.

Fields.DialogueText: Ashigara claims they’re "imitative" and "lackluster."
Pistols only get you so far. It’s the same with cannons!
Free the body, free the mind, and then the soul shall follow.
When it really gets down to it, the basics are the best. ... That reminds me, Vespucci, can you teach me how to make maps?
I would be delighted to! I just finished mapping out the Levant...
We’ve only been there once. Damn, you’re thorough!
It’s all part of being a good cartographer, Capitano! Do you want me to teach you right now?
I'd love to, but we've got company.
Dannazione! How many Morganas are there!? They just keep coming!
I'll talk to Command about it. This is starting to become a real problem... more so than usual.
Sea hags! Prepare to meet my blade!
@BATTLE
Capitano! Pray tell, what? Is it about the Morganas?
Rhodes is currently under pressure. There’s a large cell of Morganas about. It’s so bad that people can’t leave the island.
I’ve got some news, Vespucci.
The home of the Knights Hospitaller? This won't stand! Capitano, when do we head forth? I refuse to let them do that to Rhodes!
We’re set to leave as soon as Command brings us more supplies. This is going to be a major operation.
You know, Capitano, I’ve been wondering. Ashigara is certain that these Morganas are organized. Who controls them?

Fields.MenuText: There are conspiracy theories ranging from the Dutch to something in the Bermuda Triangle.
At a guess... maybe a bigger Morgana?
Maybe they're autonomous?

Fields.DialogueText: The Dutch? What would they have to gain? And Bermuda... how odd.
How large can these Morganas get? If it’s anything like that one in Athens...
It could be possible. After all, Ashigara was certain that their will was part of the equation.
Regardless, we’ll still need to give aid to the Italian authorities in Rhodes. And I can think of nobody better to help than you, Vespucci.
I shall be your guiding light, then, Capitano! With my skills we’ll not only liberate Rhodes, but we’ll establish newer, faster routes!
Down, Vespucci. This part of the world is pretty well mapped already.
A true adventurer only rests when night falls and the fire is warm, Capitano!
Sss... *Crawl* *crawl*
S-Soderini! How dare you!? I do get enough sleep!
The chameleon has a point, Vespucci.
Fine! I will rest when we finish our first day at Rhodes.
Good deal. Now, let’s say we get a little warm-up in? I see a Morgana off port.
Perhaps we’ve caught her napping?
Only one way to find out!
@BATTLE
Capitano, what's the matter? You have such a stern look!

Fields.MenuText: I have been reading all day to prepare for Rhodes.
Sharp blade, sharp mind, as you say.
I heard a hilarious joke from the XO and I’m trying not to laugh.

Fields.DialogueText: You’re thinking about Rhodes, too? I haven’t been able to stop.
I believe Ashigara put it as: "a focused mind can cut through rock."
It certainly must have been a great one if you’re so eager to remain stone-faced!
They say the situation near the islands is starting to worsen.
When do we leave for Rhodes?
Dusk. Command wants us to verify that we're stocked and shipshape.
Navigating through the night... I wonder if the weather is good enough to see stars?
If we do, I have no doubt that we’ll be the first ones to Rhodes with you leading the charge.
Thank you, Capitano! I’ll have you know I mapped our route to Rhodes while we were in the Levant.
Never let it be said that you don’t work fast.
I am not just fast, Capitano, I am focused.
Sss... *Crawl* *flick*
Eh? Soderini? What are you pointing at?
A Morgana off to starboard. He’s got good eyes.
A bit of warm-up before the main battle! Alle armi!
@BATTLE
Karpathos is just ahead! Good holy... look at all of them! If there are this many here, then what of Rhodes?

Fields.MenuText: The situation at Rhodes must be worse than we thought.
That’s nothing. We’ll clear them out and then take Rhodes by force.
Should we wait for the cavalry?

Fields.DialogueText: Hmph! It’s nothing that we cannot handle. Trust me, Capitano! We will break through them in no time.
That’s the spirit, Capitano!
We are the cavalry, Capitano! The time is near to charge.
They’re in serious force. No wonder the people of Karpathos called for help.
It's almost as if they're coordinated...
They seem to be. What should we do?
Ah, Capitano! You could ask Soderini.
Is he... willing to answer?
Certamente! Soderini loves to share his brilliant soul!
*Flick* *crawl* Sss... SsSsSs...
What does he say, Vespucci?
Capitano, Soderini suggests that we draw them out with a feigned retreat and rain fire on them when they're spread thin.
Consider it done. Let's take them all out!
I'm with you, Capitano! Come, Soderini!
*Crawl* *crawl*
@BATTLE
We're within striking distance of Rhodes.
Stay alert, Capitano! I can feel them everywhere.

Fields.MenuText: The atmosphere here is intense. I don’t think I’ve ever felt like this!
Same to you, Vespucci.
"There is nothing impossible to him who will try."

Fields.DialogueText: Do you not feel the excitement, Capitano? This is where we make our stand!
With you at my side, I shall be all but clairvoyant!
Quoting Alexander? Capitano, you’ve become even more well read!
I hope that my focus doesn’t make me go all stone-faced again.
Why not, Capitano? A focused warrior with a focused expression may strike fear into their opponents!
Well, the other deckhands saw me coming down the way and then ran off when they saw me...
Oh, for heaven’s sake! Don’t they realize that a focused leader is someone you want to rally behind?
Evidently not.
Eeee! That face... how hideous!
You seem to have spooked a Morgana, Capitano.
Not even half an hour off Prasonisi and here I am scaring things.
Do not let mere opinions tear you down. Embrace your scariness!
The only thing I’m going to tear down is this Morgana blockade.
Buono! Have at thee, sea hags!
@BATTLE
The path is clear. Let's proceed slowly.
They didn't stand a chance, Capitano! Did you see how that one ran?
I just hope that my expression doesn't cause my crew to jump ship.
Personally, I feel like dealing with a stone-faced capitano is better than washing up on some rock.
Hey, Vespucci. Since we have a bit of down time, do you want to discuss some reading?
Si, Capitano! Oh, I have this new book I’d like to show you. It’s a real winner...
Ah, Capitano! Come in! Don't mind me, I'm just finishing up a map.
There are a lot more papers in here than I remember.
Sì! I've been hard at work taking notes, creating training regimens, and writing to Ashigara!

Fields.MenuText: What does Ashigara sound like in conversation, anyway? I’ve heard she’s a bit rough.
Does she have an appreciation for the written word, too?
I wonder how she writes?

Fields.DialogueText: Incredibly blunt... and an utter joy to write to!
She very much does! Though Japanese writing can be surprisingly more stoic than most contemporary philosophy I've read.
Her handwriting is straight. Yet, sometimes it appears rough.
Huh. She writes her letters by hand?
Did you think I was the only one, Capitano?
No, I’ve heard of others writing letters. I just wasn’t expecting this out of another Belle.
She writes in black ink much like I do, though clearly with some other tool.
I usually use a ballpoint pen to... is that a pheasant’s feather?
Why, yes, it is. Isn’t it pretty? I write all of my letters with it.
I knew you were old-fashioned, but that’s a level of class I wasn’t expecting.
Words must be written in something as indelible as ink, Capitano.
Well, it looks like you’ve started using your teletype!
Si! I use it to send maps, battle tactics, and daily lessons to my students!
Not only are you learning your tech, you’re turning into a regular old teacher. The great warrior teacher, Vespucci!
Plato was taught by Socrates, Capitano. It is only natural that I impart my wisdom on anyone who asks for it. ... As long as they salute me!
I hope you’re ready to impart your wrath as well. We’ve got Morganas coming.
Then let's fight! Ashigara's latest letter has me in a battle-hungry mood!
I've heard she fights like a hungry wolf. Is that true?
She is hungry for glory like I am hungry for knowledge!
... Damn it, now I’m hungry. What do you say we eat after we clear them out?
I'll make some tea for it. We'll discuss Plato over dinner!
@BATTLE
Capitano, I've done it!

Fields.MenuText: You’ve finally finished that copy of Hemingway I gave you?
Have you gotten Soderini to change his color on command?
You finished planning your first circumnavigation?

Fields.DialogueText: I finished that when we first got into Greece, Capitano!
He still won’t... But I will not give up! I’m determined to see red.
I think I'll be planning that right up until the morning I set out!
No, Capitano, I made my first phone call today!
That’s incredible, Vespucci! ... But who did you call on the ship, and why?
The cook, of course! I wanted to congratulate the galley crew for the excellent meal they prepared for us yesterday.
It’s not often you get a meal like that, especially since we’re in wartime. That marlin was delicious.
Wasn’t it, though? I haven’t had such a meal, ever. Though we Belles don’t need to eat, I feel the need to exercise my palate once in a while.
Use it or lose it, right?
Speaking of which, Capitano... When was the last time we sparred?
I believe... Two weeks ago? Either way, the resurgence of Morgana attacks has made that hard.
*ALARM*
They're restless!
Insatiable, perhaps? Either way, we've got trouble.
Let's make haste!
Think we can fit in a spar after this?
Of course, Capitano. But! Just because we haven’t done it in a while doesn’t mean I’ll take it easy on you!
I’d be insulted if you did, Vespucci.
@BATTLE
Welcome back, Capitano! Where were you, anyway?
Out on the main deck. The meteorologists say that a huge storm is about to roll in from the south.
An adventurer will brave through any squall, storm, or hurricane to achieve their goals.
And I don’t doubt we will, Vespucci. However, we should be careful.
You may take care sometimes, Capitano. When you are up against a Morgana, however, you must stop at nothing to win!
I don’t think it’s our goal to die in battle, Vespucci. ... Unless if that’s something Ashigara told you?
Ashigara said it was part of a warrior’s pride to fall in battle.

Fields.MenuText: Today is not a good day to die.
You know, you shouldn’t take everything that girl says to heart.
Then call me the "warrior without pride."

Fields.DialogueText: Every day is a good day to adventure!
But why, Capitano? You know it’s both an adventurer's and a student's duty to heed the lessons of life!
"Without pride?" Capitano, you cannot abandon your pride!
It is my duty as captain to make sure that everyone on both this ship and in the fleet makes it out alive.
If you stay away from danger long enough, it will find you. Going by that reasoning, what is the point of being careful?
Because it is like a dance, Vespucci. You must carefully waltz through the enemy and come out on the other side stronger.
...I believe in that, Capitano. However, we cannot just sit idly by and let the Morganas gain ground! Rhodes is proof of that!
"Remember upon the conduct of each depends the fate of all."
Alexander again... Right. I trust your judgment, Capitano.
Come on. Let's clear a path they'll see from Plimmiri.
I’ll be right beside you, Capitano! Life or death, fate is in the hands of glory!
Then let's get all the glory we can!
@BATTLE
Capitano, there you are! I've brought tea - is now a good time to discuss that book I mentioned?
Tea and literature during the rain? Of course. What's the book?
Hmm. Storm's brewing.
Infantry Attacks! Are you familiar with Erwin Rommel?

Fields.MenuText: That one German officer?
I'm quite familiar with the man. I've heard he's something of a rising star.
He has a book? Since when?

Fields.DialogueText: We Italians know him for the Battle of Caporetto! It may have been an embarrassment for us, but his mastery of the terrain is unquestionable.
Signor Hitler doesn't deserve him, if we're being candid.
Since 1937! I got my hands on a... less than official translation.
Well, he survived one world war, so I assume he knows a thing or two. How's the text?
I’m halfway through the High Vosges chapter. I like his commentary on the war itself and the tactics that were used to prosecute it.
Learn anything new?
Well, about what you said the other day, Capitano. It got me thinking...
As I said, it is my duty to keep people safe and make sure the fleet makes it through to the other side.
I understand! However, there was a quote by Rommel that got me thinking: “Better too much spade work than too little! This work saves blood.”
What he said here is to work hard, understand your principles, and don’t be afraid to play it carefully. Sometimes, you can save lives without being glorious.
True. There's no glory in unnecessary sacrifice.
Capitano... I'm sorry. I know what I said was extremely selfish.
A true duelist and student takes the mistakes they made yesterday and uses them to move on to a better tomorrow.
Sì! And that's what makes a true warrior... Ah, Capitano, I'm so happy that I've helped you become a fine adventurer.
You'll help me do more than that, Vespucci. I'm certain that we'll--
*ALARM*
And we'd just sat down for tea!
The sooner we finish off these Morganas, the sooner we can have tea.
@BATTLE
You are ours!
Come one, come all! Prepare for a Regia Marina welcome!
Vada via!
You’re doing valiantly, Capitano! The Morganas are on the run!
Keep your guard up, Vespucci. Something about this doesn't seem right...
What do you mean, Capitano? We've gone through eight of them without incident!

Fields.MenuText: That right there is a Morgana and a half.
Case in point.
Should I quote Epictetus again, Vespucci?

Fields.DialogueText: Do not fear this, Capitano. Our power shall send her back to the depths!
Ah, I see what you mean.
No, I believe I understand you quite well.
Have at them, then!
*BOOM*
This is getting ridiculous. Not even Athens was this bad.
It seems they've rallied. And this storm...
We might want to look for an escape route.
That's not possible, Capitano. The storm's too bad to do more than blast our way out.
Then we'll just have to tough it out for now. As soon as we get our bearings, we're setting a course for Gennadi...
@BATTLE
Capitano! You're awake again.
Sorry, Vespucci. The thunderstorm is abnormally loud. And I can’t stop thinking.
Capitano, you need to rest. Here, let me fix some tea for you... Stay right there and just sit.

Fields.MenuText: You’re awfully worried tonight, Vespucci. I swear, I’m fine.
Seriously, I’m fine. Although I would like some tea. Thank you, Vespucci.
I think I've been waiting all night for you to say that.

Fields.DialogueText: You are not fine! Your eyes look about as glazed over as a Morgana thrall's!
Capitano, you are not fine. You look like you're on the verge of collapse. Please, drink up.
Have you ever known me to wait for anything? You still have much to learn.
Mmm... this is delicious, Vespucci!
Now, come rest your head. I know I am not a capitano myself, but you must rest. We need you at your best!
You need rest too, Vespucci.
I am a Belle, Capitano. I have no need for rest. There is only learning, philosophy, occasional vices, and adventure.
I worry about you, too, Vespucci. You might not need rest, but maintaining one’s mental strength is paramount.
Capitano, don’t you understand? A warrior must dredge past their preconceived notions. I did it the other day with you, did I not?
You did, and it made me happy. But I know that I worry about you like you worry about me. You're a teacher and a Belle of exceptional standing.
And you are my capitano and comrade; a person of exceptional strength and fortitude. You must take care of yourself...
Thank you, Vespucci. I feel a lot better now.
That's good to--
*ALARM*
Hmph! Duty calls!
I need to get to the bridge!
At-tut-tut! Capitano, I want you to stay here.
Vespucci, I’m the captain! They need me!
You need to rest. I will contact you if I need help. Trust me.
... All right, Vespucci. Give them your best, and don't be afraid.
I won't be. Sleep well, Capitano!
@BATTLE
Ah, that nap was just what I needed...
Status! What's going on? Where's Vespucci?
*BOOM*
Capitano! We're a bit surrounded right now! The Morganas are in a frenzy...

Fields.MenuText: A frenzy? What's going on?

Fields.DialogueText: I don't know, Capitano! It could be something about the storm... or is it the other way around?

Fields.MenuText: How many of them are there?

Fields.DialogueText: I count at least eight right now. This storm is ruining our visibility!

Fields.MenuText: I feel like I shouldn't have taken a nap.

Fields.DialogueText: Senza senso, Capitano! Imagine if you weren't rested for this!
This weather... so intense... Capitano! Your orders, please!
All hands to battle stations, slow the ship down to 2 knots, and prepare to retaliate!
Sì, Capitano!
Vespucci, with me. Let's take them all out!
@BATTLE
Down you go!
They’re trying to shake you, Vespucci. Keep your guard up!
Ves... pu... cci...
Wh-what!? She said my name!
I did not give any of you permission to speak my name! You will salute me or stay silent!

Fields.MenuText: Do your students salute you?
They don't know the meaning of honor!
Leave it to the Morganas to aggravate Vespucci.

Fields.DialogueText: In writing, a greeting is enough. But in a classroom setting, I would begin and end every session with one!
As Miyamoto Musashi said: “You may abandon your own body, but you must preserve your honor!”
They are a wound upon the sea itself...
I’ve noticed that you’re a lot more confident in battle, lately, Vespucci!
Ashigara sent me two books after I sent her the Enchiridion and Apologies. The Book of Five Rings is helping me become fiercer!
I'll have to read that when--
*BOOM*
Damn it! Battle stations!
@BATTLE
Finally a moment of peace. We're clear for now.
A moment without battle is a moment for reflection, Capitano.
Boy, do I have a lot of things to reflect about.
Relax, Capitano, and take them one at a time.
How am I supposed to remain calm? They've been relentless lately.
“If you do not control the enemy, the enemy will control you.”
Who said that?
Miyamoto Musashi! And his words will help us turn these tides.
You've got a quote for everything, don't you?
Many great humans do, Capitano. They'll all guide us through this.
We haven't been able to properly resupply for weeks. This so close to land... what do we do?
Capitano! You missed our sparring. What’s gotten into you!?
Capitano? Are you all right?

Fields.MenuText: I'm a bit worried, but I'll live.
Practicing my stoicism. How am I doing?
We're running out of everything, Vespucci. How do you think I feel?

Fields.DialogueText: Capitano, you look more than a bit worried.
Your grip strength is admirable, but you're barely holding it together.
I know we're short on supplies. There must be something we can do.
Vespucci, we’re in the middle of a storm, there are sailors here who have been reduced to eating the equivalent of hardtack... Shells are running low, too. Our options are limited here!
Capitano, you can’t just say all hope is lost!
I'm itemizing our woes. Faliraki's not equipped for a supply run, the storm's still raging... we're damaged every way we turn.
There's still room to ration tighter, of course. We could conserve our ammo and still do damage... But we've lost enough to Morgana attacks. If we stretch ourselves any further...
Capitano...
Yes, Vespucci? What--
*SLAP*
What was that for!?
Because you're being stupid, that's why! Can't you see that you've been holding us together this entire time?
Under your leadership, we've been cleaving through Morganas, navigating around Rhodes through the worst storm in decades, and somehow keeping the crew on their feet!
I know you're afraid, Capitano, and I know you care dearly about the crew! I know that you care about me! I care about you, Capitano! The crew all care! This ship needs her capitano, and I need you!
Vespucci, I understand. We--
*ALARM*
Another one...
Capitano...
I'll be strong, Vespucci. Come with me. We've got Morganas to take care of.
@BATTLE
Una!
Useless!
Due!
A great blow...!
Tre!
*BOOM*
*BOOM*
*BOOM*
Such strength...
Now they're just making fun of us.
If that's all they've got, we've almost got this!
@BATTLE
The Morganas... they're dispersing!
“You have power over your mind - not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.”
Capitano! I'm so proud of you!
*Lick* *fidget* Sss!
And you’re still the tightest hugger this side of the Mediterranean! Thank you so much, Vespucci.
Think nothing of it! I’ll stand by my Capitano!
Now that that’s over, though... We can’t just stand by and ignore the problem we have. That being said, I have a plan.
A plan, Capitano? What?
We need to formulate some ideas. But I’ve noticed something. The Morgana seem to thrive in the storm. That’s not all...
The greatest storms have eyes, Capitano... Maybe this Morgana fleet has a flagship?

Fields.MenuText: Would they really be coordinated enough to have a flagship?
It’s a real stretch of a lead...
Why didn't we think about this before?

Fields.DialogueText: The more we try to peel Morganas off, the more they rally. The ones that stay behind know something the others don't.
But it's the only one we've got.
Perhaps the Morganas counted on it being too obvious.
Let's say you're right. If we find the Morgana flagship, can we take it out? And will it break up their organization?
One problem at a time, Capitano. There are a few still following us.
Round and round we go. Right, take us through those shoals. Your keel's not as deep as theirs. If they act like a fleet, they'll be careful enough to break off.
Capitano, that's brilliant! I've been mapping out Rhodes for weeks. I shall guide us through with no trouble!
Then let's get moving.

Fields.MenuText: You know, this is possibly the most unsafe thing I've ever done.

Fields.DialogueText: Smooth sailing, Capitano! Rhodes is as good as saved!

Fields.MenuText: A bit too smooth, if you ask me.
You're the only Belle I know to laugh at danger.

Fields.DialogueText: With a fleet at your back and the world's greatest duelist on your side? You should take more risks!
Would you prefer if I started using the slipstreams around those jagged rocks?
“Accept death in a cheerful spirit.”
I’ve taken risks that are bigger than this, but it doesn’t make it any less dangerous. Still, I’m glad to have you with me, Vespucci.
We’re a team! A duo! We are both teachers and students, Capitano. We learn each day that we are out at sea.
Call us a squadron, then.
What do you mean by that, Capitano? Is there someone coming to help us?
I’ve contacted the base on Rhodes and they know we’re coming back. We’ll resupply there and continue. Our goal right now is to keep leading the Morganas on and hitting them where it hurts.
But how far are we going to go around Rhodes?
There’s a final destination, and if we keep up our pace we’ll be at it soon.
That reminds me, do you still have that "Book of Five Rings?" I want to start reading it.
Sì, Capitano. Here you go!
I'll trade you "Thief of Baghdad." It's not philosophy, but I know you love adventure.
That I do! ... And I love showing these sea hags their place. There are some just ahead!
Looks like they’re stuck on the rocks. Good, let’s hit them here!
Avanti verso la vittoria!
@BATTLE
So far, so good. I think we've got time for a break now that we're restocked.
The meteorologists said it was going to be a big one.
Sometimes brilliant ideas come to us when we need them most. ... I just wish it wasn’t still cloudy. It feels like this storm is lasting forever.
I understand! It’s just that I... I miss stargazing, Capitano. I’ve yearned to see the wide open skies of the ocean again.

Fields.MenuText: I have, too. It feels like watching complete darkness every night.
When this whole mission is over, I promise we’ll go stargazing.
We will, Vespucci. As long as it takes.

Fields.DialogueText: At least darkness allows us to continue to dream.
Really!? Where would we go?
To not have stars to navigate by... it's like stumbling around blindly, Capitano.
Let’s go stargazing in Athens when this is done. I hear there’s a great spot near the port to look at stars.
I’m looking forward to it, Capitano. I’m so glad we have supplies again...
I have you to thank for that. It was your level head that managed to get us this far.
I cannot take all the credit, Capitano. You were the one who got up took charge. And now we’re here!
We're not the only ones...
Accursed... looks like they found their way through the rocks.
See that formation, Soderini? What do you make of it?
*Lick* *crawl* Sss... Sss! Sss...
Soderini advises that we take this slowly, but that we should also try to force them into the rocks!
You heard the lizard! Let's go!
@BATTLE
This damn storm is intense! I can feel my sails tingling...
That doesn’t sound good. Do you need us to check them?
No, they’re just tingly. I hope the ghosts don’t appear again.

Fields.MenuText: Ghosts? What do you mean? Is there another Morgana out?
Vespucci, ghosts don’t exist. Well, Morganas do, but that’s beside the point.

Fields.DialogueText: No, I mean the wisps and waves of amethyst that torment my sails whenever it storms...
They do, Capitano! I’ve seen them on my sails numerous times. They float around up there, crackling with purple flames!

Fields.MenuText: You of all people falling for this superstition?

Fields.DialogueText: Don't insult my intelligence! These things defy my research!
Oh, so that's what's going on!
What do you mean, Capitano? Ah, there they are!
Ghh... Go away! My soul is not for you to eat!
Vespucci, those aren’t ghosts. That’s St. Elmo’s Fire.
St. Elmo’s... what? Does this look holy to you? The ghosts are right there!
It’s an electrical phenomenon that occurs during thunderstorms. Basically, you’re conducting plasma in the air and it’s causing your sails to tingle.
W-What? Capitano, how long has that been a thing!?
If memory serves, since the days of Julius Caesar who documented it in "De Bello Africo." I think one of Magellan's companions even wrote about it.
Grgh... So this entire time I was fearing nothing?
“We have nothing to fear but fear itself.” President Roosevelt said that once.
Rather sagely for an American.
For every fear there is a reason and a solution.
Well, now I feel stupid.
Well, you weren't entirely wrong about ghosts. We've got Morganas tailing us.
You! I'll teach you miscreants a lesson!
@BATTLE
Drat! They've caught up with us!
Vespucci, you aren't swearing? Just the other day--
W-Why would you bring that up at a time like this!? The Morganas are coming for us! They’ve figured out we’re leading them on!
I just didn’t think you were the type to swear. You know how it is.
I’d prefer not to! Agh! They’re getting close! Capitano, your orders!
Engage!
Come on! I could take eight of you Morganas at once at the rate you’re going!
So eager to be surrounded?
Quit your whining! See the world beyond!
*BOOM*
Another one down! Capitano, how close are we to this "point?" In fact, where are we headed?

Fields.MenuText: I don't want to spoil the surprise.
You'll see, Vespucci.
“Perceive that which cannot be seen with the eye.”

Fields.DialogueText: This is NOT the time for more surprises, Capitano!
I should hope I do!
Musashi... Capitano, you’ve been reading again!
We’re almost there, Vespucci. Try to hold on a little longer.
How many times do I have to tell you damn things I’m not interested in you!?
Captain...
Remove yourselves from my Capitano’s presence, you vile fiends!
@BATTLE
Capitano, what was that?
Our squadron, Vespucci.
What are you talking about? Moments ago, a brilliant shell hit a Morgana in the face! We don’t have mortars, do we?
We don’t, but your countrymen do. Say hello to the Rhodes Island Defense Force. They’re set up at Kritinia Castle, and we’ve just entered their range.
Capitano! You were planning this from Faliraki, weren’t you!?
“The best-laid schemes of mice and men go oft awry.” Except this one turned out beautifully. The Regia Marina beat you somewhere for once.
We’re so close to the castle!
A fitting place to defeat the flagship, if we're lucky. Are you ready, Vespucci?
Sì, Capitano! Those Morganas will think twice before rising again!
This is it, Capitano. Here come the Morganas...
There are a lot more than I remember. Perhaps since the storm’s let up, I can see more of them now? Damn, Attavyros looks pretty...
Sightseeing at a time like this!? Look at how many Morganas there are!

Fields.MenuText: Fear not, Vespucci. All we have to do is wait for them to come to us.
The mortars and turrets will take care of them.
They won’t know what sank them.

Fields.DialogueText: Sì! Capitano... I admit I'm a bit excited.
I wonder if we’d be lucky enough for the mortars to knock out their leader?
They won’t know whose blade ran them through!
This is where we make our stand! Vespucci, with me!
Fear shall not claim us this day! En garde!
@BATTLE
*BOOM*
Another wave!?
They just keep multiplying, don't they?
That just makes them easier targets.
Il tuo momento è arrivato!
Vespucci...
You dare speak my name?
Wait... they're... retreating?
Capitano... do you see her?
Looks like you were right about the lead ship.
Is it a challenge?
Looks like it. She'll be back. Are you ready?
Sempre, Capitano!
She's... she's huge!
I guess we’ve found our target. There’s only one thing left to do, Vespucci.
I am ready, Capitano!

Fields.MenuText: What a hell of an adventure this has been...
This is it, Vespucci. Stay by me!
Alea iacta est.

Fields.DialogueText: I’ll make sure it doesn’t end on a sour note!
I’m with you, Capitano! Have faith in me!
Then fall Caesar! ... Wait, I think I’m getting my quotes mismatched! Er, have at it!
Full speed ahead! We’re going to give her all we’ve got!
@BATTLE
Useless... Vespucci... Captain...
Who gave you the right to speak our names? And where is your salute!?
Keep her talking. We've got her right where we want her.
*BOOM*
A direct hit from the castle! Magnifico!
Look! She's retreating! They all are!
Capitano, we're--
Amazing!
*Crawl* *crawl* *lick* Sss!
Ah, hey! Soderini! Cut that out! S-seriously, that tickles!
Take that, sea hags! Do not return!
Hah... It’s over now. Vespucci, I say we’ve earned some tea and some food. What do you say?
You’ve taken the words right out of my mouth, Capitano!
It feels good to be back in Rhodes again. Just look at that sunrise!
Beautiful, isn't it? And we have it all to ourselves.
After the storm we just went through... it's strangely quiet.

Fields.MenuText: Yeah, it feels kind of empty without the crack of thunder... or at least a Morgana.

Fields.DialogueText: I admit... I was starting to fancy the storm. Something about the rain tapping at our windows.
Well, this will certainly be something to write Ashigara about, won’t it?

Fields.MenuText: I honestly haven’t seen a sunrise like this since my training days. It’s beautiful.
We’ve more than earned it, Vespucci.

Fields.DialogueText: I see sunrises every day, but this one is... it’s marvelous.
We have, Capitano. It’s our reward for laughing death in the face and coming out the other side.
I could write a whole novel with what we’ve been through on this trip alone. Tell me, Capitano, does adventure follow you?
Well, I follow you, and you’re an adventurer. Maybe I follow it with you?
Don’t be cheeky with me, Capitano. But being here on this island is nice...
What's nice is that the Regia Marina is taking outposts like Rhodes more seriously. They'll be following your lead for years.
Really!? Capitano, I’m honored that I get to teach them about such things!
They were glad you taught them. I know I still am.
Capitano... Never stop learning. I won’t ever let you stop learning! Do you hear me!?
“Think lightly of yourself...”
“... and deeply of the world!” You're off to a terrific start.
